item.title: Out-of-memory Micro Instance Woes: setsebool Killed
item.description: The other day I deployed a micro CentOS instance in Google Cloud’s Compute Engine. Normally 600mb of RAM is more than enough to do some light nginx/node.js work for me, but I ran into a bit of an issue when working with setsebool. In order to allow nginx to proxy websockets to my upstream node.js server, I have to loosen some SELinux boolean and to make sure this change is permanent.
